tool.name: CAMB
tool.description: Code for Anisotropies in the Microwave Background

param.name: physical
param.label: Use Physical Parameters
param.help: If use_phyical set phyiscal densities in baryone, CDM and neutrinos + Omega_k

param.name: nu_mass_degeneracies
param.label: Neutrino Mass Splittings: Degeneracies
param.help: sets nu_mass_degeneracies = massive_neutrinos. Otherwise should be an array. e.g. for 3 neutrinos with 2 non-degenerate eigenstates, nu_mass_degeneracies = 2 1

param.name: nu_mass_fractions
param.label: Neutrino Mass Splittings: Mass Fractions
param.help: Fraction of total omega_nu h^2 accounted for by each eigenstate, eg. 0.5 0.5

param.label: Massless Neutrinos
param.name: massless_neutrinos
param.help: the effective number (for QED + non-instantaneous decoupling) fractional part of the number is used to increase the neutrino temperature, e.g. 2.99 correponds to 2 neutrinos with a much higher temperature, 3.04 correponds to 3 neutrinos with a slightly higher temperature. 3.046 is consistent with CosmoMC.

param.name: source_select
param.label: CAMB settings to use
param.help: For most mapping needs use Commonly Used settings. If you want full control use Full Parameter List

param.name: do_lensing
param.label: Get Lensing
param.help: if do_lensing then scalar_output_file contains additional columns.

param.name: l_max_tensor
param.label: L max tensor
param.help: Tensor settings should be less than or equal to the above

param.name: cs2_lam
param.label: Comoving Sound Speed of the dark energy (cs2_lam)

param.name: initial_ratio
param.label: Initial Ratio
param.help: Ratio is that of the initial tens/scal power spectrum amplitudes.

param.name: initial_vector
param.label: Initial vector
param.help: If above is zero, use modes in the following (totally correlated) proportions. Note: we assume all modes have the same initial power spectrum

param.name: CMB_outputscale
param.label: CMB Output Scale
param.help: To get MuK^2 set realistic initial amplitude (e.g. scalar_amp(1) = 2.3e-9 above) and otherwise for dimensionless transfer functions set scalar_amp(1)=1 and use CMB_outputscale = 1

param.name: bispectrum_slice_base_L
param.label: Slice Base L
param.help: set slice non-zero to output slice b_{bispectrum_slice_base_L L L+delta}

param.name: bispectrum_do_fisher
param.label: Do Fisher bispectrum
param.help: Estimates errors and correlations between bispectra. Note you need to compile with LAPACK and FISHER defined to use get the Fisher info.

param.name: bispectrum_slice_base_L
param.label: Slice Base L
param.help: set slice non-zero to output slice b_{bispectrum_slice_base_L L L+delta}

param.name: bispectrum_do_fisher
param.label: Do Fisher bispectrum
param.help: Estimates errors and correlations between bispectra. Note you need to compile with LAPACK and FISHER defined to use get the Fisher info.

param.name: feedback_level
param.label: Feedback level
param.help: If feedback_level > 0 print out useful information computed about the model
